title: Ex Vivo Tissue-Resident Macrophage Replacement Prior to Allogeneic Transplantation
content: Organ shortage is one of the most pressing issues with regard to human mortality.  This issue is further complicated by the fact that HLA matching is required for patients, leading to restricted choices for transplant.  If organs or tissues from non- or partially-HLAâ€“matched donors could be edited such they evade cytotoxic T cells as well as natural killer cells, it would ameliorate the organ shortage problem.
